briefdescription.para: Whether the event was cancelled using cancel_event().
message that was created (sent).
Cluster owning the event dispatch.
Raw event data. If you are using json on your websocket, this will contain json, and if you are using ETF as your websocket protocol, it will contain raw ETF data.
Shard the event came from.
Cancels the event in progress. Any other attached lambdas for this event after this one are not called.

simplesect.para: This will modify the event object in a non-thread-safe manner.
const event_dispatch_t& reference to self for chaining

briefdescription.para: Cancels the event in progress. Any other attached lambdas for this event after this one are not called.

simplesect.para: This will modify the event object in a non-thread-safe manner.
const event_dispatch_t& reference to self for chaining

briefdescription.para: Reply to the message received in the event.

parameterdescription.para: Message to send as a reply.

mentions (pings) the author of message replied to, if true On success the result will contain a dpp::confirmation object in confirmation_callback_t::value. On failure, the value is undefined and confirmation_callback_t::is_error() method will return true. You can obtain full error details with confirmation_callback_t::get_error().

briefdescription.para: Send a message to the same channel as the channel_id in received event.

briefdescription.para: Construct a new event_dispatch_t object.

briefdescription.para: Returns the shard object for the events shard id.

Returns true if the event is cancelled. Note that event cancellation is a thread local state, and not stored in the object (because object which can be cancelled is const during the event, and cannot itself contain the changeable state).

simplesect.para: true if the event is cancelled

briefdescription.para: Copy another event_dispatch_t object.

parameterdescription.para: The event to copy from

briefdescription.para: Move from another event_dispatch_t object.

parameterdescription.para: The event to move from
